definitions: bring or recall a feeling, memory, or image to conscious awareness
elicit or draw out a response, reaction, or emotion from someone
examples: The old photograph evoked memories of childhood summers
Her perfume evoked thoughts of his grandmother's garden
The speech evoked strong reactions from the audience members
His harsh words evoked tears from the young child

definitions: develop gradually from a simple to a more complex form over time
undergo genetic change through natural selection over successive generations of organisms
examples: The company's strategy evolved over several years of operation
Her artistic style evolved from traditional to abstract painting
Birds evolved from dinosaurs over millions of years ago
The virus evolved to become resistant to the medication

definitions: make a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling worse or more severe than before
examples: The drought conditions exacerbated the region's water shortage crisis
His angry response only exacerbated the tense situation further

definitions: demand and obtain something, especially payment or revenge, from someone forcefully
inflict harm or punishment as retribution for wrongdoing or offense
examples: The dictator exacted tribute from all the conquered territories
The company exacted a heavy price for the licensing agreement
The storm exacted a terrible toll on the coastal communities
He vowed to exact revenge for his brother's death

definitions: represent something as being larger, better, or worse than it really is
increase or enlarge something beyond normal or reasonable proportions deliberately
examples: She tends to exaggerate her accomplishments during job interviews
The media exaggerated the severity of the economic crisis
The artist exaggerated the model's features for dramatic effect
He exaggerated his limp to gain sympathy from others

definitions: inspect or scrutinize something in detail to determine its nature or condition
test the knowledge or proficiency of someone through formal questioning or assessment
examples: The doctor examined the patient's symptoms thoroughly before diagnosis
Scientists examined the fossil under a powerful electron microscope
The professor will examine students on medieval history next week
The board examined candidates for their technical expertise yesterday

definitions: remove earth carefully and systematically from an area for construction or mining
carefully uncover and remove archaeological remains or artifacts by systematic digging
examples: Workers excavated the site for the new building's foundation
The mining company excavated tons of ore from the mountain
Archaeologists excavated ancient pottery from the Bronze Age settlement
The team excavated dinosaur bones from the desert site

definitions: go beyond what is allowed or stipulated by a set limit or rule
be greater in number, size, or degree than a specified amount or measure
examples: The driver exceeded the speed limit by twenty miles per hour
Don't exceed the recommended dosage on the medicine bottle
Sales exceeded our expectations for the third quarter significantly
The temperature exceeded forty degrees Celsius during the heatwave

definitions: be exceptionally good at or proficient in an activity, subject, or skill area
examples: She excels at mathematics and won several national competitions
The company excels in customer service and product innovation

definitions: exclude or leave out someone or something from a general statement or group
examples: The new policy excepts employees who joined before January first
Present company excepted, the meeting attendees were quite unprofessional

definitions: take a short extract or passage from a text, film, or piece of music
examples: The publisher excerpted three chapters from the upcoming novel
The documentary excerpted speeches from the civil rights movement

definitions: give something and receive something of the same kind in return between parties
give or receive one thing in substitution for another thing of value
examples: The leaders exchanged gifts at the diplomatic ceremony yesterday
We exchanged phone numbers after the conference networking session
She exchanged her dollars for euros at the airport
Can I exchange this shirt for a larger size?

definitions: remove tissue or an organ by cutting it out during a surgical procedure
remove a section of text or content from a written work or document
examples: The surgeon excised the tumor from the patient's lung
Doctors excised damaged tissue to prevent infection from spreading
The editor excised several paragraphs from the final manuscript
Censors excised controversial scenes from the film before release

definitions: cause someone to feel very enthusiastic, eager, or emotionally aroused about something
stimulate or give rise to activity, energy, or a physiological response in something
examples: The announcement of the concert excited fans around the world
The possibility of promotion excited her more than anything
The electrical current excited the atoms in the gas tube
Caffeine excites the nervous system and increases heart rate

definitions: cry out suddenly or speak suddenly and vehemently, especially in surprise, anger, or pain
examples: 'That's impossible!' she exclaimed when she heard the news
He exclaimed in delight when he opened the birthday present

definitions: deny someone access to a place, group, or privilege by deliberate action
deliberately leave out or not include something in a group or list
examples: The club excluded women from membership until the nineteen eighties
Security guards excluded protesters from entering the government building
The study excluded participants who were under eighteen years old
Please exclude weekends when calculating the project timeline deadline

definitions: discharge waste matter from the body through natural biological processes and organs
examples: The kidneys excrete excess water and waste products as urine
Many marine animals excrete salt through specialized glands

definitions: forgive or overlook a fault, offense, or breach of good manners
release someone from a duty, obligation, or requirement they would normally have
examples: Please excuse my late arrival to the important meeting
She excused his behavior because he was under stress
The teacher excused him from gym class due to injury
May I be excused from the table after dinner?

definitions: carry out or put into effect a plan, order, or course of action
kill someone as a legal punishment for a crime they have committed
examples: The team executed the marketing strategy flawlessly this quarter
The computer executed the program commands in sequential order
The state executed the prisoner at dawn by lethal injection
The rebels executed captured soldiers without trial or mercy

definitions: be a typical or ideal example of a particular quality or type
illustrate or clarify something by giving or serving as an example
examples: Her dedication exemplifies the company's commitment to excellence
This building exemplifies nineteenth century Gothic architectural style
The professor exemplified the concept with several practical cases
These statistics exemplify the growing trend in online shopping

definitions: free someone or something from an obligation, liability, or rule that others must follow
examples: The government exempted small businesses from the new tax regulations
Religious organizations are often exempted from certain legal requirements

definitions: engage in physical activity to sustain or improve health and fitness
use or apply a faculty, right, or power in a particular situation
examples: She exercises at the gym every morning before work
The doctor recommended exercising thirty minutes daily for health
The president exercised her veto power on the proposed legislation
Parents must exercise caution when children use the internet

definitions: apply or use physical force, effort, or strength to accomplish something
bring a quality or influence to bear on someone or something
examples: The workers exerted tremendous effort to complete the project
She exerted all her strength to move the heavy furniture
The union exerted pressure on management to increase wages
Parents exert considerable influence on their children's development

definitions: breathe out air from the lungs through the nose or mouth
examples: She exhaled slowly to calm her nerves before speaking
The doctor asked him to exhale completely during the examination

definitions: use up resources or supplies completely, leaving none remaining or available
drain someone of their physical or mental energy, making them extremely tired
examples: The long drought exhausted the region's water reserves completely
We exhausted all possible options before making the decision
The marathon exhausted even the most experienced runners yesterday
Caring for twin babies exhausted the new parents daily

definitions: publicly display works of art or items of interest in a gallery or museum
manifest or deliberately display a quality, emotion, or behavioral characteristic
examples: The museum will exhibit rare paintings from the Renaissance period
The gallery exhibits contemporary sculpture from local artists
The patient exhibited symptoms of severe anxiety and depression
She exhibited remarkable courage during the emergency evacuation

definitions: expel and bar someone from their native country, typically for political reasons
examples: The government exiled political dissidents to remote island prisons
The king exiled his brother after the failed coup attempt

definitions: have objective reality or being in the physical or conceptual world
live or continue to survive, especially under difficult or unusual conditions
examples: Dinosaurs existed millions of years before humans appeared on Earth
Does life exist on other planets in our solar system?
Some bacteria can exist in extreme temperatures and harsh environments
The tribe existed on fish and wild berries for generations

definitions: go out of or leave a place, especially a building or room
terminate or close a computer program or application
examples: Please exit the building calmly during the fire drill
The actors exited the stage after their final bow
Click the button to exit the application and save changes
The program will exit automatically after the installation completes

definitions: absolve someone from blame for a fault or wrongdoing, especially after due consideration
examples: DNA evidence exonerated the prisoner after twenty years of imprisonment
The investigation exonerated the company from any wrongdoing allegations

definitions: drive out an evil spirit from a person or place through religious ritual
rid a person or place of a troubling or oppressive feeling or memory
examples: The priest attempted to exorcise demons from the possessed woman
They believed the ritual would exorcise evil spirits from the house
She needed therapy to exorcise the ghosts of her traumatic past
The team hoped victory would exorcise memories of last year's defeat

definitions: become or make larger or more extensive in size, volume, or quantity
give a fuller version or account by adding more details or information
examples: The company plans to expand into Asian markets next year
Metal expands when heated and contracts when it cools
Could you expand on your proposal in tomorrow's meeting?
The author expanded the article into a full-length book

definitions: send a person to live outside their native country, often for work purposes
examples: The company expatriated several executives to manage overseas operations
Many professionals expatriate themselves to find better career opportunities

definitions: regard something as likely to happen or someone likely to do something
regard someone as having an obligation to do something considered reasonable or appropriate
examples: We expect rain throughout the weekend according to forecasts
I expect she'll arrive by noon based on her message
The teacher expects students to complete assignments on time
Employers expect professionalism from all their staff members

definitions: make an action or process happen sooner or be accomplished more quickly
examples: The manager expedited the approval process for urgent requests
Please expedite shipping as we need the items by Friday

definitions: force someone to leave a school, organization, or country as a punishment
force or drive out something from a container or from the body
examples: The school expelled three students for violating the honor code
The government expelled foreign diplomats suspected of spying
The volcano expelled ash and lava during the violent eruption
Coughing helps expel mucus from the respiratory system

definitions: spend or use up a resource such as money, time, or energy for a purpose
examples: The company expended millions developing the new software platform
Athletes expend enormous energy during marathon races

definitions: charge or record a cost to an account as a business expense
examples: She expensed the business lunch to her corporate account
Employees can expense travel costs for work-related trips

definitions: encounter or undergo an event, occurrence, or situation in one's life
feel or be subjected to a particular emotion, sensation, or physical feeling
examples: She experienced culture shock when she moved to Japan
The region experienced severe flooding during the monsoon season
Patients may experience dizziness after taking this medication
He experienced great joy at the birth of his daughter

definitions: conduct a scientific procedure to test a hypothesis or demonstrate a known fact
try out new ideas, methods, or experiences to discover something unknown
examples: Scientists experimented with different chemical compounds for years
The students will experiment with acids and bases tomorrow
The chef experiments with fusion cuisine combining different traditions
Young adults often experiment with different career paths

definitions: come to the end of a fixed period of validity or duration
exhale air from the lungs in breathing
die or cease to live, used formally or euphemistically
examples: Your passport will expire in three months from today
The lease agreement expires at the end of December
The patient was asked to expire slowly during the lung test
Breathe in deeply, then expire through your mouth
The patient expired peacefully in her sleep last night
He expired before the ambulance could reach the hospital

definitions: make something clear to someone by describing it in detail or revealing facts
account for an action, situation, or phenomenon by giving reasons or causes
examples: The teacher explained the complex mathematical concept using simple examples
Could you explain how this machine works to me?
Scientists cannot fully explain the mysterious signals from space
How do you explain your absence from yesterday's meeting?

definitions: burst or shatter violently and noisily as a result of internal pressure
increase suddenly and dramatically in size, number, or extent
suddenly express strong emotion, especially anger, in a violent or uncontrolled way
examples: The bomb exploded in the abandoned building at midnight
The pressure caused the gas tank to explode violently
The city's population exploded during the technology boom years
Social media usage exploded during the pandemic lockdown period
He exploded with rage when he discovered the betrayal
The crowd exploded into cheers when the team scored

definitions: use someone or something unfairly for one's own advantage or profit
make full and effective use of a resource, opportunity, or situation
examples: The company exploited workers by paying below minimum wage
Some landlords exploit tenants' desperation for affordable housing
The team exploited weaknesses in their opponent's defense strategy
Businesses exploit social media to reach younger consumer demographics

definitions: travel through an unfamiliar area in order to learn about it or discover what it contains
investigate, study, or analyze something systematically and in detail to learn more
examples: The expedition explored uncharted regions of the Amazon rainforest
We spent the afternoon exploring the old castle ruins
Scientists are exploring new treatments for the rare disease
The documentary explores themes of identity and belonging

definitions: send goods or services to another country for sale or trade
transfer data from one program or system to another format or location
examples: Japan exports automobiles to markets around the world
The company exports agricultural products to European countries
You can export the spreadsheet data to a PDF file
The software exports images in multiple file formats

definitions: make something visible by uncovering it or putting it in view
subject someone to an experience or influence, especially something harmful
reveal the true, objectionable nature of someone or something hidden
examples: The excavation exposed ancient artifacts buried for centuries
Low tide exposed the rocky ocean floor beneath
The workers were exposed to dangerous chemicals without protection
Children exposed to violence often develop behavioral problems
The journalist exposed corruption at the highest government levels
The investigation exposed the company's fraudulent accounting practices

definitions: present and explain a theory or idea systematically and in great detail
examples: The professor expounded his revolutionary theory during the lecture
She expounded on the philosophical implications of artificial intelligence

definitions: make something longer or larger in space, time, or scope
stretch out a part of one's body to its full length
offer or make available something such as help, credit, or an invitation
examples: The company extended the deadline by two weeks
They plan to extend the highway to the coast
She extended her arm to reach the top shelf
The cat extended its claws when threatened
The bank extended credit to small business owners
We extend our sincere condolences to the family

definitions: destroy completely, especially by killing every member of a group or species
examples: The pest control company exterminated the termite colony completely
Invasive species can exterminate native plants and animals
